item.title: Dangerous 60mph speed limit outside a very busy Dunkertons, 21st May
item.description:
National speed limit of 60 mph combined with narrow pavement to Charlton Kings is very dangerous outside very popular and growing entertainment location Dunkertons. The venue is used by young people and families many of whom will be walking along the pavement in the dark. Issue is ongoing and of increasing concern due to Dunkerton’s imminent expansion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping, 21st May
item.description:
Last night a cardboard box and another black bag of rubbish was added to the existing mound of detritus dumped here. That’s 3 dumps of rubbish in the space of 3 days. Why can’t you do something about this???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned dining chair, 21st May
item.description:
This dining chair has been here for a couple of weeks now, being moved around the electricity substation here. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Redthorne Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly poster on lamppost outside No 27 Everest Rd, 21st May
item.description:
One of many flyposters all over Leckhampton advertising a garden competition. It's attached to the lamppost/telegraph pole with plastic ties.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: The manhole is surrounded by a barrier & has been for weeks, 21st May
item.description:
Manhole cover surrounded by a barrier, which has been there for months, causing an obstruction to the public. Its at the junction of Grafton Road & Gratton Road, Cheltenham on the same corner as the Church of St Pips & Squeaks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gratton Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 21st May
item.description:
Station Road is an absolute death trap as cars are constantly going over the speed limit of 20mph, even at school times.  It would be great to have bigger 20mph signs as there is only a small one outside the school
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Broken and cracked asphalt on the pavement; broken and sunken kerbstones, and the whole thing a general mess!, 21st May
item.description:
At the junction of the main Gretton Road and Gopshill Lane in Gretton, by the street sign for Gopshill Lane. This has been an issue for years, and has only got worse with tractors and large vehicles (bin lorries) running over the area, as can be seen in the photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Apple Orchard Close, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Road is blocked completely with multiple vehicles and fencing,, 21st May
item.description:
GL503JX Well Walk impassable this morning, as it has become a building site, I cannot access my building as it’s fenced off. I received no advance notice and have no information as to what is happening or how long it will last. The previous works here lasted years and damaged the cobbled road surface and drain in this street. The large heavy vehicles are causing damage to buildings & road surface.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Well Walk, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: This tree is blocking the street light it needs cutting back hanging in my garden and compromising my wall foundation, 21st May
item.description:
On the pavement in Highgrove Way Churchdown adj to the lamppost I took a photo of the trees has never been cut and is very large I’ve lived in my property in Purcell Road which the tree is overhanging for over 20 years and it’s never had any attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Tallis Road, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard missing on a very lane, 21st May
item.description:
What three words shin regaining demotion I'm a resident on gambles lane which is being used as a diversion lane. The bollard is in the ditch as are several others. This is a pinch point on the lane where cars need to pass each other hence why the bollards have been taken out. This part of the lane is sinking at the edge because of the weight of traffic. it will collapse soon

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 21st May
item.description:
Customer has just been made aware of the works at the location (they saw a sign), but has received no prior notification. They state that this is going to cause them some inconvenience with visitors and a member of their household who works late into the evening. Please can Highways provide details of the extent of the works and what access arrangements are in place (is pedestrian access available?), so they can plan any contingencies.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why is someone allowed to camp on the busy pavement??, 21st May
item.description:
How is it allowed for a large tent to be erected outside the co-op next to a busy bus stop and pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Stinging nettles overgrown path, 21st May
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: No Road Markings, 21st May
item.description:
At the junction of Brunswick St and Swindon Road the road markings indicating KEEP CLEAR are completely non existent. That also goes for the next junction of St Paul's Street North. Also the cycle lane markings have also faded as to be illegible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Brunswick Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
